sect3.title: Program Files
sect3.para: addftinfo, afmtodit, eqn, geqn (link to eqn), grn, grodvi, groff, grog, grolbp, grolj4, grops, grotty, gtbl (link to tbl), hpftodit, indxbib, lkbib, lookbib, mmroff, neqn, nroff, pfbtops, pic, post-grohtml, pre-grohtml, refer, soelim, tbl, tfmtodit, troff and zsoelim (link to soelim)

sect4.title: addftinfo
sect4.para: addftinfo reads a troff font file and adds some additional font-metric information that is used by the groff system.

sect4.title: afmtodit
sect4.para: afmtodit creates a font file for use with groff and grops.

sect4.title: eqn
sect4.para: eqn compiles descriptions of equations embedded within troff input files into commands that are understood by troff.

sect4.title: geqn
sect4.para: geqn is the GNU implementation of eqn.

sect4.title: grn
sect4.para: grn is a groff preprocessor for gremlin files.

sect4.title: grodvi
sect4.para: grodvi is a driver for groff that produces TeX dvi format.

sect4.title: groff
sect4.para: groff is a front-end to the groff document formatting system. Normally it runs the troff program and a post-processor appropriate for the selected device.

sect4.title: grog
sect4.para: grog reads files and guesses which of the groff options -e, -man, -me, -mm, -ms, -p, -s, and -t are required for printing files, and prints the groff command including those options on the standard output.

sect4.title: grolbp
sect4.para: grolbp is a groff driver for Canon CAPSL printers (LBP-4 and LBP-8 series laser printers).

sect4.title: grolj4
sect4.para: grolj4 is a driver for groff that produces output in PCL5 format suitable for an HP Laserjet 4 printer.

sect4.title: grops
sect4.para: grops translates the output of GNU troff to Postscript.

sect4.title: grotty
sect4.para: grotty translates the output of GNU troff into a form suitable for typewriter-like devices.

sect4.title: gtbl
sect4.para: gtbl is the GNU implementation of tbl.

sect4.title: hpftodit
sect4.para: hpftodit creates a font file for use with groff -Tlj4 from an HP tagged font metric file.

sect4.title: indxbib
sect4.para: indxbib makes an inverted index for the bibliographic databases a specified file for use with refer, lookbib, and lkbib.

sect4.title: lkbib
sect4.para: lkbib searches bibliographic databases for references that contain specified keys and prints any references found on the standard output.

sect4.title: lookbib
sect4.para: lookbib prints a prompt on the standard error (unless the standard input is not a terminal), reads from the standard input a line containing a set of keywords, searches the bibliographic databases in a specified file for references containing those keywords, prints any references found on the standard output and repeats this process until the end of input.

sect4.title: mmroff
sect4.para: mmroff is a simple preprocessor for groff.

sect4.title: neqn
sect4.para: The neqn script formats equations for ascii output.

sect4.title: nroff
sect4.para: The nroff script emulates the nroff command using groff.

sect4.title: pfbtops
sect4.para: pfbtops translates a Postscript font in .pfb format to ASCII.

sect4.title: pic
sect4.para: pic compiles descriptions of pictures embedded within troff or TeX input files into commands that are understood by TeX or troff.

sect4.title: pre-grohtml and post-grohtml
sect4.para: pre- and post-grohtml translate the output of GNU troff to html.

sect4.title: refer
sect4.para: refer copies the contents of a file to the standard output, except that lines between .[ and .] are interpreted as citations, and lines between .R1 and .R2 are interpreted as commands about how citations are to be processed.

sect4.title: soelim
sect4.para: soelim reads files and replaces lines of the form .so file by the contents of file.

sect4.title: tbl
sect4.para: tbl compiles descriptions of tables embedded within troff input files into commands that are understood by troff.

sect4.title: tfmtodit
sect4.para: tfmtodit creates a font file for use with groff -Tdvi.

sect4.title: troff
sect4.para: troff is highly compatible with Unix troff. Usually it should be invoked using the groff command, which will also run preprocessors and post-processors in the appropriate order and with the appropriate options.

sect4.title: zsoelim
sect4.para: zsoelim is the GNU implementation of soelim.
